p: Fruit and twig EO have a lower content of the linalool and eugenol allergens than that of leaf EO. The European Cosmetic Directive prohibits the use of these allergens unless they are a natural constituent of plant EO or other natural flavoring (as in the case of laurel EO). These allergens must not exceed the permissible concentration of 0.01% in shower gels and rinse-off products and must not be higher than 0.001% in body oils, massage oils, and creams [ 37]. Due to their opulent chemical composition and characterization, the inclusion of oils in different cosmetic products will be a subject of our next research.
